page.title: 11INDUSTRY.
page.content: Newlyn Fishmarket is one of the main sources of work in the village of Newlyn.Also it is the fourth biggest fishing port in England.There are around 160 boats that work to catch the fish.The main source of fish in 1982 was mackerel and it was over 3,000 tonnes.But over the years the number of mackerel has gone down dramatically.All types of fish are caught - white fish,oily fish and shell fish.It is auctioned at the market and goes all over Britain and across the channel to other European countries. Penlee Quarry overlooks Newlyn harbour.Blue Elvan is quarried here this is used to surface roads and is used here and abroad.Stone boats call at Newlyn. { { {
